intro: Symphostemon articulatus, commonly known as the articulated symphostemon, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, branching structure. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in racemose inflorescences. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
